{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3143652,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-11T14:56:20.534Z","cooked":"

Hello! I’m on the programming team for GalacTech 4926 and I’m working on auto-balancing on the Charge Station for the 2023 game. We have the code working very well as of right now. Here’s a video that demonstrates balancing and our Open Alliance post if anyone wants to read about it.

I have incorporated a functionality that always sets the gyroscope yaw to zero degrees (more detail in the Open Alliance post linked above). This has always worked fine. Once we started testing auto-balance, I started to notice a glaring problem. When we climbed/jumped/full-throttled on the Charge Station, Our robot would align, but it would always align ~15 degrees counterclockwise. After that, once we get off the Charge Station, it would consider that offset as zero degrees.

I suspect it’s because we’re getting on the Charge Station pretty roughly and that misaligns the gyro. It may also be because our robot jumps into the air (a little bit) and lands onto the station at an angle. Does anyone have any suggestions, questions, or is facing the same problem? Feel free to reply to this. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-11T14:56:20.534Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":247,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":1265.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":426439,"topic_slug":"gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing","display_username":"Pranav Ramnath","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtu.be/Uw_FL_jidi8","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"4926 Mecanum Auto-Balancing on Charge Station - YouTube","clicks":43},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/galactech-4926-build-blog-2023/420401/13","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"GalacTech 4926 - Build Blog 2023","clicks":28}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54054,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4926 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing/426439/1","custom_user_title":"Team 4926 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3143657,"name":"Kellen Watt","username":"Aelenian","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a587f6/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-11T15:13:11.309Z","cooked":"

In my experience, a little bit of jostling on a macroscopic scale doesn’t affect the angle too much. This sounds like you’re landing at 15 degrees clockwise or thereabouts, relative to your charging station. It’s also possible your charging station isn’t square with your starting position, so your robot is going to “zero”, but that’s not zero relative to the charging station.

Another possibility might be that you’re the victim of gyro drift, depending on how long you’ve had the robot on by that point. Normally, for match-scale times, gyro drift is fairly negligible. But if the robot has been sitting there for 15-20+ minutes before you use it, you’ll start getting noticeable drift, on the order of ~15 degrees.

This might also be dependent on what gyro you’re using. I only have experience with the NavX sensor, which might not be what you’re using.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-11T15:13:11.309Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":52.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426439,"topic_slug":"gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing","display_username":"Kellen Watt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"It *probably* works!"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing/426439/2","custom_user_title":"It *probably* works!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3143669,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-11T15:33:06.431Z","cooked":"

I’m using the navX sensor right now. It’s properly secured to the roboRIO on the MXP port (with the bolts and everything). Our Charge Station is properly aligned with our starting position. I’m also resetting the gyro every time I start testing (with the robot at the ideal ‘zero’ position). While all the things you mentioned are definitely cause for error, we’ve already accounted for all of that. Could it also be because our gyro is getting worn out or damaged?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-11T15:33:06.431Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426439,"topic_slug":"gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing","display_username":"Pranav Ramnath","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52594,"username":"Aelenian","name":"Kellen Watt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a587f6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54054,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4926 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing/426439/3","custom_user_title":"Team 4926 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3143684,"name":"Kellen Watt","username":"Aelenian","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a587f6/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-11T16:11:21.544Z","cooked":"

It’s possible. But unless you’re putting your gyro through hell, they have a reasonably long lifespan (we’ve been cycling through the same set of 3 for years).

I’m afraid I don’t know what the issue is. I’d recommend trying to pare down your code until you see the issue disappear (in a different project, obviously). This seems like it might not be a gyro problem. The one thing I can think of is that it might be, at least in part, an issue with when you reset the yaw, since you say the issue carries over once you dismount.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-11T16:11:21.544Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":84.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":426439,"topic_slug":"gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing","display_username":"Kellen Watt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":54054,"username":"pranav","name":"Pranav Ramnath","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"It *probably* works!"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing/426439/4","custom_user_title":"It *probably* works!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3143695,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-11T16:33:54.642Z","cooked":"

Yeah it could be a lot of things. Right now I’m just thinking of this possible fix:

  • Have a reset button for the gyro on the controller.
  • if driver notices that the yaw isn’t working, they can turn the robot and eyeball where they want the ideal ‘zeroed’ position to be.
  • Reset the gyro with the button once we rotate the robot to the ideal angle.

It’s not perfect but it could be useful! If it doesn’t help me I hope it helps one of you guys reading this. Thanks for the help @Aelenian!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-11T16:33:54.642Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":92,"readers_count":91,"score":43.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426439,"topic_slug":"gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing","display_username":"Pranav Ramnath","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52594,"username":"Aelenian","name":"Kellen Watt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a587f6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54054,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4926 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing/426439/5","custom_user_title":"Team 4926 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3145496,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-14T21:27:25.162Z","cooked":"

I don’t have this problem anymore and this is what I feel fixed it:

  • We’re using our new navX2 gyroscope from Kauai Labs. This gyroscope is working very well for now.
  • We also attached an arm to the robot. This increases the mass of the robot and doesn’t cause it to jump like before (when all we had were the wheels and chassis).

Anyways, after a while of good old PID tuning, the robot balances on the Charge Station really well (without any gyroscope offset).

Hope this helps!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-14T21:27:25.162Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426439,"topic_slug":"gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing","display_username":"Pranav Ramnath","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.kauailabs.com/store/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=69","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"navX2-MXP Robotics Navigation Sensor","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":54054,"username":"pranav","name":"Pranav Ramnath","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54054,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4926 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-offset-when-auto-balancing/426439/6","custom_user_title":"Team 4926 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3145522,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-14T22:07:04.161Z","cooked":"

You likely were exceeding the specs. I’m not sure if this is a settable parameter in the NavX2 or not. Range is settable in many accelerometers and gyros. From its blurb:

  • Errors due to Extreme inertial events are minimized: The combination of increased 4000 degree/second gyroscope range, 16G accelerometer range and high-speed Kalman Filter based on this data greatly minimizes Yaw angle errors due to vibration and high-speed impacts.
